title: Conqueror Should be Adaptive
body:
So the new runes were implemented so anyone could take any rune. 
Riot had the idea that runes are more focused on a play style and less on specific champions so Riot creates runes reformed. This was meant to allow anyone to use any rune they wanted. They accomplished this by giving every rune a hybrid scaling or giving it adaptive damage. But, when they added Conqueror it seems they forgot give this rune any adaptive ability. The rune only gives bonus AD when activated and will never give bonus AP.

So my question to you is why? Why does Conqueror only give bonus AD?

IMO Riot should give it bonus AP and maybe some AP fighters would arise from this change, or better yet some new playstyles for champion. I think some champion that could use it would be {{champion:131}} {{champion:245}} {{champion:60}} {{champion:79}} {{champion:82}} {{champion:76}} and {{champion:68}} 

Lastly, do you guys believe it could be a good addition to the game?

For the most part, percents are not additive in this game.
So 20% gets converted to true damage through conq.
Then 10% of the remaining 80% gets converted to true damage through IE.

Also, Randuin's works for IE. So against someone with both conq and IE, Randuin's is technically 80% effective.

Fun fact. In its early stages, Conqueror was called Embiggen and gave adaptive stats (either AD or AP). It was changed because Riot thought AP scaling tanks and champs like Rumble would "abuse" it. 

Then again if a tank "abuses" it, they lose out on and exchange most of the Resolve tree (literally 90% of their non kit tankiness) for damage.
Good to know
I still think Conqueror should be adaptive. Especially considering champs like the aforementioned Rumble don't really have a keystone and is a sustained damage dealer.
